qas.question: When was abortion criminalized in Britain?
When was the death penalty introduced in Britain?
What year did Labour win a general election?

context: Wilson's government was responsible for a number of sweeping social and educational reforms under the leadership of Home Secretary Roy Jenkins such as the abolishment of the death penalty in <b1_0>1964<b1_0/>, the legalisation of abortion and homosexuality (initially only for men aged 21 or over, and only in England and Wales) in <b0_0>1967<b0_0/> and the abolition of <b2_0>theatre censorship<b2_0/> in 1968. Comprehensive education was expanded and the Open University created. However Wilson's government had inherited a <b3_0>large trade deficit<b3_0/> that led to a currency crisis and ultimately a doomed attempt to stave off devaluation of the pound. Labour went on to lose the <b4_0>1970<b4_0/> general election to the Conservatives under Edward Heath.
